KIN Brown Bourbon is a smooth bourbon that can be sipped or used to make your favorite cocktail. Made from corn, rye and malted barley, and using a special filtration process, KIN provides a bourbon steeped in tradition, with a modern taste

Combines the highest quality select grains of rye, malted barley and corn with purified water. The rye provides the perfect level of spice, while the malted barley allows the sweetness of the corn to peak through, creating a sensational taste.

Like many in Sonoma, master distiller Matt Weese grew up in the wine business. But his passion has always been for whiskey. So a few years ago he and a couple partners begin building a distillery-barn in the Sonoma hills. They are currently bottling two whiskies, a bourbon and a rye. Both are made from a blend of grain spirits sourced in Indiana, Tennessee and of course California. They are aged for at least 2 years in white oak barrels on site in Healdsburg.

The plan is to eventually use only locally sourced grains and distill and age everything in their own barn. In the meantime the current releases allow whiskey enthusiasts to taste Matt's approach, which is heavily influenced by his wine background. He emphasizes a balance of spice, herbs and sweetness with a judicious amount of oak spice. And unlike many craft whiskies, Lost Republic is priced for everyday consumption. We highly encourage you get on board early with this exciting project

NOBLE OAK is a unique award winning bourbon with a worthy purpose. We at Noble Oak are fanatics about wood. That’s because 70% of a bourbon’s flavor comes from the wood. With Noble Oak, we elegantly marry two of the world’s most coveted types of oak used in whiskey making: American White Oak and Spanish Sherry Oak. We use time honored methods and our patented Compression Finishing™ process to create an unrivaled bourbon with body, deep color, and richness of flavor from some of the finest sherry oak staves. The result is a Great Bourbon with a Noble Heart.
No Description

Sourcing whiskey has been a source of contention within the whiskey world over the last few years with some people refusing to drink a product that isn’t distilled in house by whoever releases it.  I on the other hand simply enjoy good whiskey wherever it comes from, especially if it comes from MGP in Lawrenceburg IN.  This release of Huling Station Bourbon from Old Dominick in Memphis TN comes in at 100 Proof.

Although initially developed for the making of Spanish sherry, the solera method of aging has since crossed into the production of wine, beer, brandy, and whiskey such as this from Oppidan Spirits in Illinois. Along with corn, the bourbon mashbill includes malted rye, chocolate malted rye, special B caramelized malt, and 2-row barley. It ages solera-style in barrels of American oak, French oak, and Oloroso sherry casks, with only the American oak barrel ever getting emptied.

Made with pure texas water and aged in american charred oak barrels to create an incredibly smooth whiskey. Portions of the profits are to be donated to texas native wildlife conservation. Images of three native texas animals are on each bottle. Start a collection today! 41. 2% abv 82. 4 proof

Bourbon is distilled from Arkansas corn and wheat right here at the distillery in downtown Little Rock. We're proud that we keep things local. We age our bourbon here at the distillery in small new charred oak barrels that were coopered right here in Arkansas at Gibbs Brothers Cooperage. That's right, we use Arkansas Corn, Arkansas Wheat, we distill the whiskey in Arkansas, age it in an Arkansas made barrel to be Arkansas' first ever Bourbon Whiskey. Our Bourbon is milled, mashed, fermented, distilled, aged, bottled and packaged at the distillery in Little Rock. We're makers not fakers. Mashbill: 82% Arkansas Corn, 9% Arkansas soft red winter wheat and 9% malted barley. Non-chill filtered.

Founded more than a decade ago by California surfer Rodney “Rod” Cegelski, and Aussie Hamish “Hammer” Marshall, Rod & Hammer's Slo Stills crafts American spirits. The story of Slo Stills began in 1988 at the Slo Brew brewery. In 2012 they distilled and aged their first whiskey, a rye beer mash made in the original Garden street copper kettle. They realize that the most important ingredient and the crucial part of distilling is time ― hence the name. Their other not-so-secret ingredient is purified oceanic water, as every spirit of theirs is cut with Pacific Ocean water. "California meets Australia," as they say.

Dried & malted grains are milled, exposing the starches within. Then they add water, cooking the mash in order to convert those starches to sugars. Yeast is then added to the wort in fermenting tanks, starting the fermentation process that converts the sugars to alcohol, and turns the wort into beer. This beer is then distilled. The resultant spirit is then transferred to charred new American Oak barrels, where it matures from 6 months to 2 years or more. Before bottling the spirit is filtered and brought to proof with purified oceanic water.

The Rod & Hammer Slo Stills Cask Bourbon Whiskey is an uncut and non-chill filtered bourbon that's bottled straight from the barrel at 112 proof. It's crafted with a mash bill of 55% corn, 35% rye, and 10% malted barley. The expression spends 2 years in new American white oak barrels, resulting in a bold whiskey with gentle smoke, oak, vanilla, and caramel notes, with just the right amount of sweetness and warmth.

The Burning Chair
Intense and expressive, this is the first release of Dave Phinney’s highly anticipated four year-old Bourbon.

Sourcing
Each barrel is hand-selected for it’s unique attributes by Dave. The youngest Bourbon in the blend is four years old. Tiny lots are procured from Kentucky, Indiana and Tennessee. Each barrel brings something special to the final blend.

Barrels
Aged for a minimum of four years in new charred American oak barrels and then uniquely finished in wine barrels from Dave’s Napa Valley Cabernet projects.

Water
The mature Bourbon is titrated to 88 proof with pure, pristine water from Dave’s high elevation property in Alexander Valley in Northern California.

Mash Bill
75% Corn, 21% Rye, 4% Malted Barley

Profile
Aromatically intriguing with brown sugar, caramel, butterscotch and toasty oak. The palate is smooth and lush with loads of vanilla bean, baking spices, maple and baked apples. The finish is long and exciting, begging for another sip.

All grain is grown within 50 miles of the distillery. Direct relationships have been forged with local farmers and grain is grown to a precise specification. Yellow corn makes up the bulk of the recipe, followed by rye and malted barley.

Whole kernels are delivered to the distillery and then milled and mashed on site. Following fermentation, the wash is distilled in a 20 plate, 24” Vendome Copper amp; Brassworks column still. Five batches of distillate are blended at a time for consistency prior to barreling.

White American Oak Char #3 barrels are hand-crafted by local cooper Seguin Moreau and the Bourbon is aged for a minimum of three years, and often longer. All aging is done on site in one of three locations, all with ideal yet different conditions relating to temperature, humidity, sunlight and air flow.

Once deemed mature by Master Distiller Jordan Via, a portion of the Bourbon is transferred to Dave Phinney’s Cabernet Sauvignon barrels for a period of about two months. This additional aging adds flavor, texture and character.

50% ALC. BY VOL / 100 PROOF

The Land
After research spanning multiple seasons, a particular plot of land was selected in Winters, California (approximately 35 miles from the distillery) for its nutrient rich soil, maximum sun exposure and access to water.

The Grain
An ancient heirloom grain, the Howling Mob corn comprises 86% of the recipe. The balance is 14% malted barley. The Howling Mob corn, notoriously low yielding and susceptible to weather, strikes a balance between decadence and elegance. Malted Barley completes the mashbill and provides structure as well as flavor.

The Production
True grain to glass. Every element of production from growing the grain to fermentation time to distillation and the barrel regimen was controlled internally. No detail was overlooked. Supreme quality Seguin Moreau char #3 barrels ushered this Bourbon from cradle to maturity imparting toasty oak, vanilla, intensity and character along the way.

Tasting Notes
Rich amber hues with bright aromas of fresh orange zest and Madagascar vanilla bean. Smokey charred oak mid palate finishes with cinnamon bark and ground peppercorn. Full bodied and balance.

The Specs
Only 31 barrels produced; singular release that will not repeat due to extreme low yield
4 years old
100 proof / 50% alc./vol

Warbinger is a heavily smoked bourbon, using mesquite to smoke the corn that goes into the mash. The palate has notes of peaches, sweet corn, and a mix of spices all emerging on the tongue. On the finish, the smoke comes back for a knockout punch, lingering interminably.

Each hand-bottled batch of Pierside Bourbon is distilled with a classic high rye mash bill for complexity and a hint of sweet corn and barley. We age Pierside Bourbon in new American Oak barrels and allow them to breathe in the fresh and salty air of Huntington Beach.

The O.Z. Tyler Distillery, located in Owensboro, Kentucky, is noteworthy in whiskey lore for a few reasons. Historically the facility, as bourbon writer Chuck Cowdery pointed out in 2016, is “a revival of the old Medley Distillery, home of Ezra Brooks and other bourbons, which United Distillers (now Diageo) acquired in 1991 and closed in 1992.” In modern times it is owned by Terressentia, best known for its patented TerrePURE process that’s designed to rapidly age spirits such as whiskey. The company acquired the property in 2014 after it lay dormant for many years, fixing it up, opening it to the pubic and laying down whiskey the old school way, albeit it with a bit of a 21st century touch in the mix.

Today, word is O.Z. Tyler is releasing the first fruits of its aging labor. The new O.Z. Tyler Kentucky Bourbon Whiskey, according to those behind it, is a blend consisting of 70 percent locally sourced corn, 21 percent rye, and 9 percent malted barley. It was aged in #4 char oak barrels for a year and a day, in a nod to tradition, and then fast filtered for eight hours with the TerrePURE process to reportedly leave “a smooth liquid with a great mouth-feel that tastes comparable to other fine bourbons.”
This traditional Bourbon is aged for 4 years in custom charred American Oak Barrels for a smooth, rich, and slightly sweet finish. Can be sipped neat, with water, with ice, or mixed into a cocktail.

79% Corn, 21% Peated Malted Barley
This unique spirit pairs the sweet robust flavor of corn bourbon with the elegant smokiness of single malt whiskey. The mash bill possesses subtle notes of vanilla, buttered popcorn, sea salt, fresh cut grass and light smoke.

What started off as an experimental mix of grains developed into a delicious bourbon unlike any other on the market.

Distilled on-site from Michigan corn and Scottish barley. Aged in full-format 53 gallon new American oak barrels.

We built our distillery building here on our horse farm and started out with a 26 gallon still back in 2013. Last year we upgraded to a 750 gallon hybrid pot still and 1000 gallon mash tanks, but the process hasn’t changed. Wade grinds our corn on an antique corn meal grist mill, which was a real step up from the hand crank Amish mill we used for our early batches. He then cooks the mash of corn and oats thoroughly, before letting it cool down to proper temperature for adding the barley and finally cool down enough for yeast to be added. My job is usually to pitch the yeast and make sure its happy. Happy yeast makes for a good fermentation. Wade checks the fermentation every day until it is ready to distill. 

Our mash bill is unique, it is 80% corn, 10% oats and 10% barley. The high corn lends a sweetness, particularly in the finish and oats add smoothness and velvety mouth feel.

Wade raises Clydesdale horses (you know, like the famous beer company), which is why our logo has a rearing horse.

A traditional bourbon from an untraditional place, Wyoming Whiskey Small Batch is the original, flagship and defining product from the Wyoming-based distillery. The whiskey offers soft aromas of cornbread, vanilla, and summer flowers, bright flavors of lemon zest and coffee cake, and fresh notes of spring garden, with a gentle, mellow finish. Wyoming Whiskey Small Batch will be familiar to fans of the soft, smooth profile of wheated Kentucky bourbons, but its commitment to Wyoming - the grains, the water, the climate, and the people - make this whiskey truly unique and worth trying.

Based high in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado at an altitude of 9600 feet, Breckenridge Distillery calls themselves “The World’s Highest Distillery.” And yes, we are pretty sure that the pun is intended. If you took a hard look at their impressive range of nine product offerings and more than two-dozen awards — including winning “Distillery of the Year”… twice — you might think that they have been around a long time. But Bryan Nolt founded the place in 2007. That makes their numerous achievements even more impressive.

Stave + Barrel is our single barrel, double oaked, high rye bourbon for the bourbon drinkers who enjoy the traditional flavours of bourbon but want something new in the mix. We have found that adding a bit more rye to the mash gives our bourbon a more pronounced variety of flavours. As with all bourbon, Stave + Barrel

Ironroot Republic’s Harbinger is an overproof straight bourbon whiskey bottled at 57.5% ABV. It took home the title of “World’s Best Bourbon” at The 2020 World Whiskey Awards. Brand tasting notes describe it as having maple syrup, orange marmalade and red fruits on the nose with flavors of red fruits, baking spices and dark sugars on the palate.

By rules, 51% of the ingredients must be corn. Although corn is the least expensive ingredient, we only use this minimum requirement, so we can add other types of grain to make the bourbon more flavorful, regardless the higher costs. Besides the corn, we use malted barley and malted rye depending on the specific recipe. These ingredients are originated from California, from high quality producers.

Beer Barrel Bourbon is first aged in new American oak barrels for several years, before a three month beer-y slumber. The beer-barrel aging lends biscuity notes and a smooth malt character to the robust whiskey tones of toffee and caramel.

Not only is R6 Blue Corn Bourbon one of the first to be made in Los Angeles, but it's also one of the city's most complex. R6 Distillery makes this award-winning craft bourbon from nutty blue corn. The lavish sip opens with fresh aromas of raisin and fig before melting into delicious depths of caramel, cinnamon, and a unique nuttiness. It's the rich dark chocolate finish that makes R6 Blue Corn Bourbon unforgettable.

bottle: Slo Stills Distiller's Reserve Bourbon Whiskey
description:
Dried & malted grains are milled, exposing the starches within. Then they add water, cooking the mash in order to convert those starches to sugars. Yeast is then added to the wort in fermenting tanks, starting the fermentation process that converts the sugars to alcohol, and turns the wort into beer. This beer is then distilled. The resultant spirit is then transferred to charred new American Oak barrels, where it matures from 6 months to 2 years or more. Before bottling the spirit is filtered and brought to proof with purified oceanic water.

The Rod & Hammer Slo Stills Cask Bourbon Whiskey is an uncut and non-chill filtered bourbon that's bottled straight from the barrel at 112 proof. It's crafted with a mash bill of 55% corn, 35% rye, and 10% malted barley. The expression spends 2 years in new American white oak barrels, resulting in a bold whiskey with gentle smoke, oak, vanilla, and caramel notes, with just the right amount of sweetness and warmth.

bottle: Shelter Single Barrel Four Grain Lost Sierra
description:
Blending pure mountain water, American grown corn, rye, wheat and barley, Shelter Bourbon exemplifies the American spirit. Striving to do better, to be better, to make the best bourbon we can, there isn’t another singular spirit as American as bourbon, and we strive to honor that tradition. From a base of Blue Corn grown in California and White Corn grown in the Midwest, to the Alpine Water, Lost Sierra Bourbon and Tributary Bourbon embody that spirit. While we can’t compete on volume with the monolithic distilleries in Kentucky, our handcrafted bourbons are a product of the purest alpine waters, hand selected ingredients, and a passion for the art and science of distillation. 

One of the greatest aspects of our country is diversity of climate, and here in the American West, we have daily temperature swings and a climate unlike anywhere in the US. These temperature swings swell and contract the American Oak barrels in our warehouses, which pulls and pushes the spirit in and out of the wood in a manner not found elsewhere. The dry climate aids in pulling more spirit into the wood, and these fluctuations ultimately create a spirit that is as unique as it is bold.

Not all Bourbon is made in Kentucky, but all Bourbon is American.

Belfry Double Barreled Bourbon Whiskey is a collaborative project with our friends and nextdoor neighbors at Bissel Brothers Brewing. After they age their “Angels with Filthy Souls” maple porter and their “Sigel” oatmeal stout, we take the empty barrels and fill them with our Bourbon Whiskey and let it age for another six to ten months.

What emerges is still a fairly youthful whiskey with an extra warmth and complexity that’s wrapped in a touch of vanilla and butterscotch. The texture is soft and silky with an intriguing chewy softness. This one’s a sipper, either straight from the bottle or with a little chunk of ice.

Belfry is produced in ultra-small batches and as a limited release—our first batch was a mere 1200 bottles.

Our Bourbon is genuinely an Ardent Spirit! On the nose it’s all about smoke and wood. It’s that smoldering campfire deep in the pine forests of Maine, slowly going out, that’s simply perfect for roasting marshmallows. On the palate, however, it’s all about the heat. It’s youth and vigor come through in an almost brandy-like way. Here is a bourbon cut from a 19th century template, when young and robust whiskeys warmed the breasts of the folks who settled and tamed a continent.

Our Bourbon is as straight forward expression of Bourbon as it gets—only three ingredients make up the mash-bill and their proportions unabashedly scream “Bourbon!”

Bourbon’s backbone comes from corn and our Bourbon Whiskey tips the scales at a solid 75%. For structure, flavor and a little spicy kick, our Bourbon Whiskey has a relatively high rye component at 21%. The final 5% is malted barley—just enough to make the chemistry work.

A wonderfully unique "high malt" Bourbon made like a Cognac with a fruit and floral character.

Crispin Cain has been working in Wine and Spirits in Northern California since 1983, including serving as assistant distiller to Brandy-master Hebert Germain-Robin. He founded Greenway Distillers in 2005 and Tamar Distillery/Mendocino Spirits in 2008. From their small craft shop in Redwood Valley they produce several bands of premium Spirits, including Low Gap Whiskey, Russell Henry Gins, Fluid Dynamics Cocktails, and DSP 162 Vodkas along with Absinth and Liqueurs.

Latitude Beverage Co., in partnership with Owensboro Distilling Company (formerly O.Z. Tyler), is expanding the Wheel Horse Whiskey portfolio with Wheel Horse Bourbon. Following the successful launch of Wheel Horse Rye earlier this year, Latitude continues to collaborate with the historic Kentucky distillery to bring this new Bourbon to life.

Wheel Horse Bourbon was aged between two and four years at Owensboro Distilling, the westernmost distillery along the famed Kentucky Bourbon Trail. Crafted by Master Distiller Jacob Call, a third-generation distiller and seventh-generation Kentuckian, Wheel Horse Bourbon is a Straight Bourbon whiskey made from a mash bill of 70% corn, 21% rye, and 9% malted barley. This whiskey is produced through the traditional sour mash method, distilled in copper stills, and matured in hand-selected, 53-gallon, charred American oak barrels. It is non-chill filtered and bottled at 101 proof (50.5% ABV).

This nearly half-and-half mix of alembic pot mixed-grape brandies and column-still brandies is mostly aged at least seven years, with 33 percent of the blend two or three years old. Like Argonaut’s Saloon Strength and Speculator bottlings, this carries pineapple and lemon along with coconut, smoke and apple.

Designed to appeal to bartenders (it’s not yet available at retail) and specifically to be mixed in cocktails, this brandy is made entirely with a column still, most of it an unspecified mix of grapes that includes Sultana (otherwise known as Thompson seedless), Chardonnay and Colombard. It is an interesting mix of two-year-old (45 percent) and older stocks ranging from 10 to 19 years old. The spirit flaunts pineapple, lemon, vanilla and dusty oak, but when mixed in a cocktail as a simple sour it is wonderfully fruity and almost sherbet-like, with apple, vanilla and chocolate undertones.

Sahara Date Brandy, A new introduction to the world of alcoholic spirits, Sahara Date Brandy brings you a new flavour unique to market. Sahara is the name of a new category of alcoholic drinks made from Date fruits farmed in Coachella Valley California.

Fundador Sherry Cask Solera, the original legend
 

Fundador Sherry Cask Solera is the updated version of the brand's icon, to revitalize and premiumize the category after more than 40 years of success. An unprecedented launch that will be available in such important markets as the United Kingdom, Italy, Mexico and the United States, as well as Spain.

 

From the cap (closure) to the embossing with the date of birth of the winery, or the new double label, it seeks direct communication with the consumer, taking care of every detail. In addition, the incorporation of a QR code on its back label allows for further information, favoring this approach.

 

It is brandy's moment and, for Ángel Piña, Global Chief Commercial & Marketing Officer of Fundador and Emperador Distillers Spain, like everything good in life, "we had it in front of us, but we didn't value it enough". 

 

"At Fundador we are finally reclaiming and highlighting a treasure that other categories, such as the best Single Malt Whiskies in the world, discovered and have been using for a long time, that is, refining or finalizing the aging process of the liquid with sherry casks that have previously contained sherry wine. These casks are unique in the world, and it is in the Marco de Jerez where "the magic" has to happen."

 

"Being owners of Harveys (Harveys Bristol Cream is the world's best-selling sherry brand according to IWSR 2020 data), gives us the possibility to select the best Sherry Casks to refine our best brandies Fundador."

France- St-Remy VSOP embodies the iconic and historical worldly renown taste of St-Remy. Its taste of small freshly picked red berries also brings out the sweet vanilla flavor of oak. Its light and subtle nose is excellent neat, on ice or with a simple mixer.

Every November, Hachiya Persimmons explode onto the Santa Monica Farmers Market. This sweet and custard-like fruit, with flavors of brown sugar, cinnamon, mango and apricot, makes a wonderful contribution to my seasonal cocktails.

The challenge is that the season is only three weeks long. So, looking for a way to share their magic year round, I have teamed up with Murray Family Farms and The Spirit Guild to create this very special brandy, the first made entirely from organic Hachiya Persimmons. 

Matthew Biancaniello got his start at The Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel and helped pioneer the farm-to-glass movement.

The Spirit Guild is a craft distillery founded by sixth-generation farmer Miller Duvall. Located in downtown Los Angeles, The Spirit Guild captures the abundance and innovation of California by creating spirits entirely from local citrus.

Brandy is bottled in a 375 ml bottle.

FREE SHIPPING offered within California

Distillery pickup is also available with 24 hour notice starting Monday Nov. 22rd.

White rums are usually not aged. Caliche has four different aged rums (3 4 5 and a small portion of solera – 3 stacked layers of barrels) which add a particular character aroma and depth. Caliche uses the solera system. There is a 3 layer arrangement of casks. When using solera rum for production you take the maturate from the lower layer casks which are the oldest. Those casks are then refilled with product from the casks in the middle layer. Maturate from the upper layer is then used to refill the casks in the middle one to replace what was used 40% abv rating: ultimate beverage challenge 87 points (mar 2015). Slightly funky nose but not an herbaceous funk: earthy and woody. There’s also lemon and alcohol. Flavors are dominated by wood notes as well along with molasses sweetness. Good long finish with mouth-watering sweetness.

DEADHEAD® Rum, a glorious cane spirit outfitted with likely the most striking bottle since the invention of packaging with its standout artist rendered shrunken head bottle, strong message about authenticity and attention to craftsmanship in distilling that takes the experience beyond the bottle to the glass. In contrast to its rather macabre bottle, the rum is a genuine thing of beauty. DEADHEAD® Rum is ideal for sipping after dinner, it’s assertive aromatics and brilliant flavors make it a great choice for use in classic tall drinks. Tasting NotesIt has a rich amber hue, an impossibly light body and a bouquet saturated with the aromas of coffee, chocolate, allspice, cinnamon and nutmeg, all of which carry through to the palate along with the added flavors of cloves, anise and caramel. The long, spicy finish seals the deal. DEADHEAD® Rum is skillfully balanced between dry and semisweet making it a franchise player behind the bar.

A fairly light, premium rum with vanilla notes on the finish, Oronoco is a very nice Brazilian import. It is a blend of Brazilian sugar cane spirit and aged rum, which sets it apart from cachaça (the Brazilian spirit that can only be produced from sugar cane juice).

El Castor is the original California cactus Brandy. Made from one of the most exotic and untamed plants on the west coast, the beaver tail cactus, which provides the prickly pear fruit for the spirit. El Castor is crafted using a proprietary fruit to glass process. Each bach is hand-harvested from select estates, fermented, distilled, aged and bottled on site to maintain artisan quality standards.

While some of the rye is exported for premium blends around the world, Alberta Distillers is famous for their ability to distill a unique 100% rye whisky in the right way besides also producing award-winning vodkas from Alberta wheat.

For "whisky fans to experience a 100% rye whisky in its purest form: straight from the barrel," Alberta Distillers released a cask strength rye. Alberta Premium Cask Strength Rye Whisky is an innovation in the Canadian whisky category with a 100% Canadian prairie rye mash bill and Rocky Mountain water. Matured in American White oak casks and bottled at 65.1-66.1% ABV, this premium rye whisky features a complex nose with sweet and woody and full palate of smooth caramel and vanilla flavors, balanced by notes of baking spice and black currant. Named "World Whisky of the Year" by Jim Murray’s Whisky Bible 2021 and the Best Cask Strength Whisky in 2020, this is a must for all rye connoisseurs and amateurs alike.

Black Velvet Reserve - an excellent blended whiskey, which for eight years aged in barrels made ​​of white American oak. Black Velvet Whiskey first reserve appeared in the alcohol market in 1991. Black Velvet Reserve in 2009, won a silver medal in the International Review of Spirits Award and awarded the title of «Best Buy» from Bar Competition, won the Gold Medal in the contest Monde Selection competition.

History of Black Velvet began in the 40s of the last century. Given an order to create a whiskey, the first specialists distillation using selective rye and corn, of which received three times distilled spirits. After dilution with spring water and aging in oak barrels, the new whiskey was left to mature. Thus was created a unique Canadian whiskey, which is characterized by tenderness, softness and exceptional. The new drink was chosen name that reflects its velvety taste and softness - Black Velvet (Black Velvet). High-quality Canadian whiskey immediately found its fans and became in great demand. Today, Black Velvet Distilling Company maintains a rich tradition and high quality, using selective grain, crystal clear water and soaking whiskey to perfection. Black Velvet is sold in 50 countries and is the clear leader among Canadian whiskey. More: https://winestyleonline.com
Our CC Reserve is for those who appreciate the deeper oak notes that come with maturity of long years in our white oak barrels. It is a whiskey of exceptional character and richness.
A bottle of Canada's most famous whiskey, distilled in 1984.
A bottle of Canada's most famous whiskey, distilled in 1984.

bottle: Canadian Club 8 Year Sherry Cask Finish
description:
Canadian Club Sherry Cask is a small batch Canadian whiskey that’s aged for eight years in white oak and then finished in Spanish sherry casks.  It sits at the top of the Canadian Club lineup and, unlike the standard six-year bottle, is definitely made for sipping.

On the nose, the Sherry Cask is fairly subtle, with hints of caramel and maple underneath the alcohol.  The taste is more robust, bursting with lots of sweet caramel, nuttiness and peppery spice.  There’s much less fruitiness than I was expecting the sherry casks to impart into the whiskey.  It finishes long and warm, with that grippy spice outlasting the sweetness.  Despite the spice, it’s still fairly soft on the palate and doesn’t require any water or ice to mellow the flavors.

Overall, Canadian Club Sherry Cask has a lot going on.  The sweet caramel and peppery spice flavors don’t always play nice, but keep sipping and it all eventually comes together.  It’s a nice effort by Canadian Club and certainly worth a try.

BRAND / DISTILLERY Canadian LTD Whisky

BOTTLED bot 60/70's

CL 75cl

%ALC 80 US-Proof

BOTTLER MC Guinness

Caribou Crossing is the world’s first single barrel Canadian whisky, selected from our finest whisky available from our inventory of more than 200,000 barrels. The whisky has been patiently aged in oak for many years to give it a rich and complex yet smooth flavor. Each barrel is then bottled individually with expert care and skill under rigorous quality standards

bottle: Canadian Extra Old 10 Year Blended Whisky [1984]
description: .E.O. CANADIAN WHISKY PRIVATE RESERVE CEO 10 YEARS OLD 1985 BOTTLE WHISKEY 750 MLC.E.O. is a truly fine ten year old Canadian Whisky that has been specially aged and blended for that perfect balance of smoothness and flavor.

A very old bottle of America's best selling Canadian Whisky, distilled in 1960 when the brand was still produced by Seagram's. They distilled the whiskey at their site in Waterloo, Ontario until 1992 when the company was dissolved and production was taken over by Diageo.

Crown Royal was introduced in 1939 by Samuel Bronfman, then president of Seagram as a tribute to the royal visit of King George VI and his wife, Queen Elizabeth (the current Queen's late mother), the first such visit to Canada of a reigning monarch of the United Kingdom.

This truly outstanding Canadian whisky is sold exclusively in the U.S. The Crown Royal blending lab has so perfected the art of blending that each whisky becomes a seamless unit. Blenders’ Mash is a rare opportunity to taste a component of that unit. Distilled from 60% corn, 36% rye, and 4% malted barley, then matured in new oak, this whisky is massive and bourbon-like. It ages slowly in Canada’s cold winters for 13 years, becoming very complex, yet not too woody. Rather, it is packed with creamy caramels, vanilla, gingery white pepper, dark fruits, floral tones, and accenting barrel notes

Crown Royal Noble Collection 16 Year Old Rye Blended Canadian Whisky.
This award-winning whisky is bold and spicy upfront, softened by creamy vanilla, sweet caramel, honeycomb and hints of stone fruit.
Hints of cinnamon, anise and clove leave a lasting warmth in the finish.

Canadian Whisky note the lack of the 'e' in whisky has always been prized as a gentle, delicate whisky style that suits American palates well and remains very popular, particularly in the northern states. Harwood Canadian Whisky is a long-established

bottle: Hirsch Selection 8 Year Canadian Rye Whiskey
description: Hirsch Selection is a brand of American whisky from Preiss Imports, who bottled to the original A.H. Hirsch Reserve, and is intended to evoke and honour this legendary batch of Rye.

bottle: J.P. Wiser's 23 Year Old Cask Strength Blended Whisky
description: The latest Wiser's in Corby's annual special release is their first cask strength, at a fat 64.3%, a blend of corn and rye whiskies that have matured for at least 23 years (to celebrate their Master Blender's twenty-three years at the distillery). The colour is a pale gold. One the nose the corn is very apparent, with buttered popcorn, hot caramel and marzipan. Then the rye shows up with freshly sawn pine and pencil shavings. Fruity with green apple skins; also heather, vanilla pods and cinnamon. Wood smoke as well. Water really opens it up with even more smoke, leather and tobacco. It's a lovely nose, elegant yet also with some oomph. Hot on the palate with more caramel, cinnamon hearts, chili pepper, heaps of vanilla and lots of oak. Thick mouthfeel. Dark honey. With water it's a bit spicier, and with more wood.
A bottle of Lord Calvert Canadian whisky, bottled in the United States. We estimate this was bottled in the late 1980s.

bottle: The Maligne Range Excelsior [Kensington Wine Market]
description:
This single-cask Canadian whisky was made from a 50/50 mash of peated malt and malted wheat, matured 8 years in a First Fill ex-Bourbon cask. The first 'Excelsior' release from the Maligne Range is a collaboration with Kensington Wine Market, bottled at 48%. 

7 years ago Andrew made this whisky with Bryce Parsons at Last Best Brewing in Calgary. The whisky was filled into an ex-Bourbon Barrel, which had previously matured a Jefferson's Reserve Bourbon KWM exclusive bottling. When they made the whisky, they had no idea when, or under what brand it would be bottled. 

Way back in October of 2016, Kensington Wine Market had a once used Jefferson's Reserve Bourbon Barrel, from one of our store-exclusive bottlings. It had a lot of life left in it, so we set about finding something to do with it. Working with Bryce from Last Best Brewing & Distilling, it was decided we should fill the cask with spirit. A little more than 8 years later, that whisky is spirit.  "The Maligne Range is an independent Canadian malt whisky-maker and blender. We distill small batch whiskies that are the vital essence of our expressions. These highly-flavoured whiskies from unique grain bills are the character actors on our whisky stage. We allow them to age in oak casks for a minimum of 5 years, affected by the capricious Alberta climate. We then blend with an ensemble cast of blending whiskies – some we distill, others are collaborations with renowned Canadian distilleries. The result is a range of Canadian whiskies that blaze new trails into the remote Western Canadian wilderness of possibility.

"The Maligne Range is the result of decades of experience brewing some of Western Canada’s best craft beers. The people who created Jasper Brewing, Banff Ave Brewing, Last Best Brewing & Distilling, and Campio Brewing have built on their experience and passion for craft spirits with this uniquely Canadian whisky brand. Like those breweries, The Maligne Range aspires to become a community cornerstone through the celebration of the craft of making Canadian whisky.

"In late-spring 2024 we will be inviting visitors to our new home in Jasper. The Maligne Range experience centre will be a celebration of Canadian whisky and elevated dining with a unique Jasper twist. Set against the spectacular backdrop of the Athabasca Valley, our guests will discover the full Maligne Range of products including house exclusives, curated cocktails and gastronomy that complete the experience.

Beyond the Tekarra whisky that we are previewing today, other planned Western Canadian Whisky releases in the works will be named after the mountains in the Maligne Range as well. These include limited special editions or casks under the Excelsior series – with the first release planned being a Kensington Wine Market cask that was filled back in 2016. Core expressions beyond this are also in the works.

To promote the Tekarra and future Malgine Range bottles, a whisky Experience Centre will be launched in Jasper in the spring of 2024. It was started by the founders of Last Best Brewing and Distilling, which is located in Calgary, Alberta. Master Distiller Bryce Parsons leads the whisky program.

The distillery at Last Best is small, but mighty, and has been used for quite a bit of spirit experimentation since its inception by Bryce Parsons and his cohorts. Bryce spent a year creating and releasing a different small batch gin every week back in 2018. Before then, and since, whisky distillation and creation have also been a major goal. Bryce also created a whisky called The Beast, which was a whisky distilled using malt that was exposed to smoke in the 2016 Fort McMurray wildfire. One bottle of The Beast sold for $10,000 Canadian at auction, and all proceeds from the limited release of 50 bottles were donated to Fort McMurray Firefighters Charities Association, which distributes money to other local organizations.

Back to the Tekarra. The whisky we are tasting today is a preview, with the full bottle release planned for mid-January 2024. It is made up of two components.

The first component whisky was distilled at Last Best from malted barley, then matured in a combination of ex-Bourbon barrels and New American Oak barrels with a level 3 Char made at The Barrel Mill Cooperage of Avon, Minnesota.

The second component is a little bit different. It was a distillation of what was essentially an Imperial Porter recipe without the hops. It included four different types of malted barley: two crystal malts, one chocolate malt, and a brewer’s malt, PLUS roasted wheat and Demerara sugar. The Demerara sugar would be considered a flavouring component under the Canadian Whisky 1/11 or 9.09% rule. This flavouring component was mashed, fermented, distilled, and aged together with the first component.

The result is the whisky in front of us, bottled at 48% ABV.
MacNaughton Canadian Whisky Liter from 1979

The initial 21 year old release as part of the Northern Border Collection in 2017 featured additional aging in Speyside scotch whisky barrels. I never picked up the 2018 release that was aged in Hungarian oak (as that kind of finishing isn’t something I typically enjoy). But last year, they released a version that used Oloroso sherry casks for aging – which is much more likely to be up my alley. I typically enjoy single malt scotch whiskies aged in sherry casks (Oloroso in particular – with their classic nutty, dried dark fruits, rancio and tannic oak notes). Sherry oak casks are not something you come across too often in Canadian whisky, so this was certainly worth a gamble.

Like most Pike Creek’s, this is made predominantly from the light base, column-distilled corn whisky that underpins most Canadian whisky, aged for 21 years. Added to this base is a touch of column-distilled rye whisky, for extra peppery spice. The blend was then finished (or re-gauged, in Canadian whisky parlance) in Oloroso sherry casks for an undisclosed period of time.

Bottled at 45% ABV. This edition retails for $90 CAD at the LCBO in Ontario. I picked up my bottled on sale in Alberta for a bit less late last Fall. Only 4481 bottles were produced, but it can still be found in some jurisdictions (including Ontario).

Of note, this whisky won Whisky of the Year at the Canadian Whisky Awards in early 2020. This competition involves blind taste testing by an experienced panel of Canadian whisky reviewers, and is always worth a close look every year. You can learn more about these awards in my Canadian Whisky Trends for 2020 article.

bottle: Pike Creek Double Barrel 10 Year Rum Finish
description: Canada- Rested 10 years in white oak barrel. Unique conditions dramatically increase interaction between wood and whisky. Finishing in rum barrels imparts rich aromas with hints of molasses and brown sugar. Awarded Gold Medal for Best Canadian Whiskey at WSWA Tasting Competition 2019.

Seagram's VO Gold 8 Years Old Canadian Whisky Introduced in 1998, Seagram's VO Gold preserves the core character of Seagram's VO while adding a dimension for the discriminating palate. The result of the Master Blender's work is a rich flavor that maintains the underlying delicacy and balanced taste that characterize the original Seagram's VO, but with a smoothness of it's own.

RON BACARDI ANEJO PUERTO RICAN RUM 6 YEARS OLD
EXTRA SPECIAL BOTTLED 1970s
WAX & VITALE IMPORT - GENOVA

Facundo Eximo is a premium rum produced by Bacardi in the Bahamas. It is made from a blend of molasses and sugarcane juice and aged in oak barrels for a minimum of 13 years. The rum is known for its rich, complex flavor and aromas of oak, vanilla, and caramel.

Facundo Eximo is part of the Facundo rum collection, which includes a variety of aged and flavored rums. The brand is named after Facundo Bacardi, the founder of Bacardi, and is inspired by the lavish, tropical lifestyle of the Bahamas.

Facundo Eximo is typically enjoyed neat or on the rocks, but can also be used as a base for cocktails. It is a popular choice among rum connoisseurs and is often praised for its smooth, balanced flavor and elegant finish.

Gran Reserva Diez is aged for a full 10 years under the Caribbean sun. Filtered only before aging, with bright notes of stone fruits, banana and pear, balanced with caramelized vanilla and oak. Enjoy neat or on the rocks

This is a single cask of Classic rum from the original batch that was created in 2001 and has been in a single cask for the last 17 years. This is a mixture of pot and column still rum from throughout the Caribbean.

Rhum Clement is one of Martinique's oldest and most respected distilleries. The Habitations Clement was founded in 1887, but didn't begin producing rhum in earnest until the French Alcohol shortages during World War I. The Agricole style of rum arose from several factors namely the creation by Napoleon of the sugar beet industry, which decimated sugar prices. This left sugar growers in French Territories with any extreme excess of raw sugar and very little incentive to process it. The easiest way to recoup the investment was to fresh press the cane and distill immediately rather than spend energy refining the sugar. It wasn't until the French began taxing rum imports that Agricole Rhum truly began to flourish. It became the only affordable Caribbean rhum on the continent and has become ingrained in the French drinking culture. In a lot of ways Agricole Rhum can be compared to Armagnac. They are both distilled on traditional alembic column stills, rather than the industrial columns of the Spanish style or the funk pot stills of the British. Because of the inherent instability of raw cane fermentation tends to be quite high ester, resulting in extremely funky flavorful white rhums. As these rhums age those esters interact with the complex chemicals naturally present in oak to create some of the most complex and unique spirits available anywhere in the world. This special cask was distilled from 7 varieties of cane and aged in New American Oak and bottled at cask strength.

This rum is aged in the crafted tradition of the Cruzan Distillery a minimum of 2 years and blended with older rums for a richer flavor. Those who prefer a stronger, more pronounced flavor in rum drinks will enjoy the character developed in Cruzan 151.

bottle: Cruzan Rum Premium Dark (Vintage '97) 2 Year Rum
description: No information - 2 Year Dark Rum. Some dusty funk on this particular bottle - beware!

A blend of vintage rums aged up to 12 years, Cruzan’s single barrel has won countless awards at the Los Angeles International Spirits Competition, New York World Wine & Spirits Competition, Rum Masters, and Tasting International Spirits Competition (2015).

bottle: Cruzan Single Barrel Estate Rum (12 Year) [Vintage]
description:
Single-Barrel Rum (Estate Diamond, St Croix, US Virgin Islands) -- aged 12 years

Nose: Sea air, brine, pickle juice, capers, olives, young oak, young sugarcane, caramel.

Taste: Young sugarcane sweetness with contrasting oak tannins, bark, caramel, burnt sugar.

Finish: Cinnamon, charred oak, olive juice, leather, sour young green wood, a little bit of generic herbs.

A fantastic rum from Antigua, which has been made in copper plated continuous stills.

Produced from molasses, this is a dark and tasty spirit, matured in oak barrels for 5 years. The rum serves up plenty of bright apple-y spirit flavours, with some toasty dark oak and brown sugar notes, and a little coconut and pineapple.

A versatile rum, great in stirred drinks or when drunk over ice.

Martinique is synonymous with rhum agricole and Neisson is the leader of the domestic market, as well as being the only one owned by a woman, led by her son and master distiller Gregory Vernant Neisson. Sugar cane comes exclusively from its own plantations, about 40 hectares in the municipality of La Carbet, north of the island. After a long struggle, she managed to get the three non-hybrid varieties that still continues to grow in the discipline: malanoi, rubanée and cristalline. The fermentation on indigenous yeasts from its properties is allowed to develop for 72 hours, the longest of all the French Antilles, and develops a unique aromatic complexity. The distillation still rests on the historical copper Savalle column of 1938, at 73 °, low alcohol content to obtain a spirit of great structure. The 52.5 ° version of white agricultural rhum is an innovative label that has been very successful. It is produced by the only canne bleue variety grown in the parcel of Thieubert, near the ocean. Following the principles of Neisson, distillation is artisanal, with a maniacal care for details.

Rhum J.M has raised the bar with this new release. Aged using two proprietary toasting techniques, one dubbed 'intense,' the other, 'extreme,' the team here is able to produce layers of flavors that jump out of the glass and pop on the palate. Luckily the rhum itslef is so naturally full of character it is only elevated further from this treatment. A pleasure on its own with a couple of rocks and a must have on hand for cocktails.

Aged in toasted new American oak for 3 years, Rhum J.M VO is robust and spirited. It is a crowd pleaser for rum and whiskey drinkers of all ages and is the gateway to enjoying and appreciating older rum vintages.

Enjoy it on its own or relish in its brilliance in an old fashioned or manhattan.

Nose: Heavy aromas of wood and vanilla are complimented by dried fruit and coconut. Over time the palate opens up into much more grilled tropical fruit notes.

Palate: Lush and spicy at first taste, particularly winter baking spices. These flavors transform into toasted wood and vanilla flavors followed by subtle hints of dried and exotic fruit.

One of our favourite rum distilleries here at Fine Drams, Rhum J.M. produces a superb quality of Rhum Agricole. The distillery grows all its own cane, on the volcanic slopes of Mount Pelée (probably the only distillery in the world built on a volcano!). Whilst this might sound perilous, the volcanic soil provides a perfectly fertile environment for growing cane. This cane is then pressed and the juice fermented, as is the way with Rhum Agricole. This creates a more fragrant and grassier style than rum produced with molasses or Demerara. This rum has been distilled in column stills, before a three year maturation in re-charred Bourbon barrels and a finishing period of a year in lightly toasted American virgin oak casks. On the nose aromas of thick fudge, meringue, cinnamon, nutmeg and clove greet the drinker. The palate brings a wonderful buttery palate, with some citrus rind, fudge and salted caramel, with a little grassy cane juice. The finish is soft, yet linger with tropical fruit notes of overripe bananas. Bottled at 43% ABV, this gives the flavours a little extra kick. Another classic bottling from Rhum J.M.

In the past, a ship's captain would take a ladle of rum, add gunpowder and ignite it to provide "proof" of the rum's integrity to his crew. Sailor Jerry continues this age-old tradition of serving quality spiced rum to provide an unmatched base for mixed drinks. 

The brand prides itself on creating spiced rum the old-school way, using an expert blend of carefully chosen spices in high-proof rum for a perfectly balanced liquid. Because sailors refused to water down their spirits, this 92-proof spiced rum definitely offers a historically accurate experience.

Crafted after intensive research into historical maritime rums, Sailor Jerry developed a smooth rum with a rich flavor. The result is a high-proof spirit that's perfect for mixing in your favorite cocktails, including Long Island Iced Teas, Mai Tais and Mojitos. The rum features prominent oak and vanilla flavors with hints of cinnamon and clove spices.

Inspired by our Mexican roots, Kahlúa Chili Chocolate brings together luxurious flavors of chocolate and chilli pepper heat, to create an incredibly indulgent rum & coffee liqueur, like you’ve never tasted before.

 

An unexpected and unforgettable blend, made just for you.

 

Flavors of rich milk chocolate, followed by the warm taste of chilli peppers, with subtle hints of caramel and vanilla—a sweetness and spice, that rolls across your tongue. There’s nothing quite like it.

The finest cocoa beans from Africa are selected to make this liqueur, which releases the full flavour of dark chocolate in the mouth, together with hints of vanilla. A recipe that combines all the velvety smoothness and the power of chocolate. Appearance An appealing, smooth chocolate colour. Nose A sweet, supple attack prolonged by smooth, intense chocolate aromas. Mouth Starts off with an opening dominated by intense cocoa notes, followed by delicate vanilla and caramel notes.

Made to an original recipe created by Ugo Borghetti in 1860. Borghetti Coffee Liqueur is obtained from real espresso coffee. Its flavour is most typically Italian, characterised by a special blend of the finest coffee from around the world, prepared in huge coffee pots. Drink it straight, with ice or mixed.

Cantera Negra Café is the perfect blend of coffee and our 100% pure blue agave spirit, which is hand-crafted in small batches from our finest agave harvests. The result is a rich café flavor that is smooth and silky, with just a touch of smokiness. Cantera Negra Café is so smooth it can be sipped over ice – and it is unparalleled as a café liqueur for any drink recipe
Medium-roasted Colombian Arabica beans are carefully blended with smooth Caribbean Rum to create this super mixable liqueur.

bottle: Slow & Low Coffee Old Fashioned Liqueur (Rye)
description:
The Cooper Spirits Co. has announced its new Slow & Low Coffee Old-Fashioned, the first-ever expansion of its Slow & Low brand. Slow & Low Coffee Old-Fashioned contains a blend of straight rye whiskey aged two years; Intelligentsia Cold Coffee made from a blend of coffees from Ethiopia, Guatemala and Peru; raw honey; demerara cane sugar; aromatic bitters and orange peel. 

The new expression, rolling out nationally this fall, is inspired by Café Brûlot, the classic coffee drink from New Orleans, where the Slow & Low brand first launched.

It is produced in partnership with Intelligentsia Coffee.

bottle: Jumping Goat Cold Brew Coffee Liqueur
description:
Jumping Goat has produced a deliciously rich coffee vodka liqueur that combines fair trade organic cold brew coffee, spices, spring water, and New Zealand vodka! What's the storey behind the name? According to legend, while watching his goats nibbling coffee berries and jumping around, renowned Ethiopian goatherd Kaldi was inspired to harvest them (the berries, of course) and make a delicious brew!

Tasting Note:
Super rich and chocolatey, with roasted coffee bean, warming spices and slightly bitter espresso.

The star ingredient of numerous cocktails, the slight sweetness and classic coffee flavor of Kahlúa make it the perfect addition to drinks made with milk or cream. Hailing from Veracruz, Mexico, Kahlúa coffee liqueur is lovingly crafted using only the finest ingredients, such as 100 percent Arabica coffee beans (which are light-bodied and smooth thanks to the Veracruz climate) and real sugarcane, giving it the mouthwatering flavor and slight kick loved by many.

bottle: Black Hjerte Barrel Aged Coffee Liqueur
description: Coffee liqueur is fairly self-explanatory: it’s coffee and alcohol mixed together! However, people have come to expect certain things from coffee liqueur, including a somewhat sweet flavor to balance out the sharp tang of the alcohol and coffee. Commercial brands of coffee liqueur include Kahlua and Tia Maria. Made with Honey, vanilla, brown sugar and coffee.

Coffee liqueur is fairly self-explanatory: it’s coffee and alcohol mixed together! However, people have come to expect certain things from coffee liqueur, including a somewhat sweet flavor to balance out the sharp tang of the alcohol and coffee. Commercial brands of coffee liqueur include Kahlua and Tia Maria. Made with Honey, vanilla, brown sugar and coffee.

Mr. Black is the new cold brew coffee liqueur from one of the world's great coffee cultures - Australia. I don't know what it is about the Aussies and their beans, but they don't play around when it comes to coffee. They take high quality 100% Arabica coffee and roast it in house at their small distillery north of Sydney. Producing consistently concentrated cold brew and fine-tuning water composition, temperature and time are lifelong obsessions for both the distillery's head of coffee, Detlef Mohr, and Master Distiller, Philip Moore. The concentrated flavors of the bittersweet cold brew are melded with the soft sweetness of Australian wheat vodka to create a drink of balance and power. A hint of cane sugar is added to add depth and open the dark rich flavors of the Arabica beans. Expect ten times the coffee and half the sugar of a traditional coffee liqueur - these guys just made the Espresso Martini cool again.

Griffin’s Wharf 1773 Coffee Liqueur starts with the finest blend of beans from Central and South America roasted at a high temperature to produce a full-bodied brew offering a deep flavor with smoky qualities. We brew our base coffee at the precise temperature to maximize flavor and then add the highest quality spirit, molasses, pure cane sugar and other natural flavors to produce this classic coffee liqueur in the spirit of the American Revolution.

Color: dark mahogany with Amber reflections.

Smell: the olfactory profile is rich and complex, with a succession of scents that refer to hints of vanilla, tea, spices and chocolate.

Palate: the taste is characterized by soft notes of candied fruit, honey and spices.

Description: the Cognac Sélection des Anges by Maison Pierre Ferrand is a Cognac of great charm, persuasive, intense and soft. It has an interesting aromatic complexity that perfectly combines fruity notes and tertiary developments. A perfect Cognac to look for us in the glass sensations of great balance and harmony.

This pours a bright amber color, with restrained but beautiful aromas of white flowers, orange, peach and honey. On the palate, it's full-bodied, with bitter orange peel and stone fruit flavors, with lingering vanilla and oak. The alcohol feels relatively balanced, but it creeps up on you. This needs dilution, so use it in punches as intended and you'll be fine.

An amber, almost golden yellow color. The subtle vanilla nose develops floral notes of rose and violet. Fruity plum and apricot aromas, move towards notes of sweet apple and pear pastries. Pierre Ferrand Ambre is fresh and well-balanced on the palate.

A true testament to Parce’s dedication and craftsmanship, every batch of our exclusive 8 and 12-year Colombian rums is a meticulous blend of 100% real aged, premium rum. Our signature 8 Year expression offers an artfully balanced blend of rich flavors that warm and entice the palate, while the complex, rich profile and lingering finish of our 12 year sipping  rum is perfect for the most discerning taste. Whether a casual rum drinker or an international spirits aficionado, every bottle of Parce invites you to experience our award-winning rum con gusto.

Mexico- Smooth, silky textured and nuanced, Nixta is the purest form of ancestral corn distillation with a nose of roasted corn, the sweet and creamy texture of atole, and a finish of roasted nuts and dried fruit. Serve neat, on the rocks, or as a distinctive cocktail modifier.

Experience the rich, smooth flavor of Bender's Old Corn 8 Year Small Batch Whiskey. Aged for a minimum of 9 years in charred oak barrels and blended in small batches, each bottle boasts subtle notes of toasted wood, vanilla, and caramel with a honeyed finish. Perfect on the rocks, with ginger beer, or in a Boulevardier. Elevate your taste with each sip.

Abasolo El Whisky De Mexico is crafted and distilled from 100% Mexican Cacahuazintle (kaka • wha • SINT • lay) corn, which has been cultivated and passed down for more than 200 generations by local farmers for its distinct, extraordinary flavor. 

Deep, nuanced notes of roasted corn, honey, vanilla, black tea, and leather, revealed through nixtamalization, are true to our Mexican ancestral corn provenance and unlike any other whisky profile.

Abasolo uncovers the deepest flavors of ancestral corn through nixtamalization, a 4,000-year-old cooking technique never before used in whisky production, but fundamental in preparing corn as food in Mexico.

bottle: Single Barrel Native Oaxacan Yellow Corn
description: Master mezcalero Douglas French captures the flavor of native Oaxacan heirloom corn in this unique and singular spirit—the first single-barrel Mexican whisky available in the U.S. Distilled in San Agustín de las Juntas, each of French’s trio of whiskies uses a single variety of ancestral corn that requires hand-harvesting, promoting jobs in traditional farming. Aged for a mere 10 months in French oak, Yellow has swirling notes of blue iris, dried chilies, and fresh linen around a core of plump corn, with tangy marmalade, maple syrup, pepper, and a spiced-honey finish. —Jonny McCormick
No description

Havana Club Especial 1L is made from a mixture of an old rum and a young rum, which are then aged in oak barrels. It is a rum that combines the brilliance of a white rum with the thickness of a dark rum.

Discover the sweet notes of vanilla and honey, the light smoking, the spicy memories of cinnamon

Opuntia is a prickly pear spirit, made from the fruit of the Nopal cactus. Its flavor is as singular as tequila’s, an invigorating balance of fresh fruit and desert earth that is all its own. Over a ton of sun-ripened California fruit is fermented into wine and then distilled in each batch. This is a new spirit tradition that belongs to California.

The Bacoo is the Caribbean version of the "Genie in the Bottle." Bottles found floating in the ocean or upon the sandy white beaches are said to have small wish granting, highly charismatic and sometimes deviant characters inside. Pop the Cork and Unleash the Spirit!. Mad ewith fresh sugar cane juice.

Dominican Republic- Rare Dominican Republic rum. 100% sugarcane Agricole rum. Unlike other agricoles, which tend to have overly herbal notes, Lemba is well balanced and higher proof. making it a great product for juice-base mixology. Lemba Agricole is a delicious un-aged rum.

Dominican Republic- Lemba Superior is a very clean Spanish molasses style rum. It is aged for one year in American oak, then refiltered to a crystal clear profile. An incredible spirits for all carbonation cocktails.

Aromas: sugarcane, molasses, orange, honey, with a hint of flowers and eucalyptus. Tasting notes: Chocolate, orange, caramel, vanilla, almond, and coffee. Note from the Rum producer: We are proud to be pioneers in the handcrafting of rum, hailing from one of the smallest countries in America: El Salvador. Ron Cihuatán’s story begins in one of its valleys, where the ancient Mayan city of Cihuatán remains undiscovered. To this day, this city lies buried with most of its secrets and history. Legend has it that a Goddess came to Cihuatán many centuries ago, and bestowed its lands with riches and fertility. She then went to sleep on the valley to always look after its crops. Her spirit still watches over our sugarcane fields, remaining in the shape of the Guazapa Mountain. Our rum is named after this legend: in Nahuat “Cihuatán” means “the land beside the sleeping woman”.
Tequila is 100% agave Azul spends 48 months in French oak. The French oak aging process make the extra anejo an exquisite delight to the planate with extraordinary aromas and flavors.

Cantera Negra translates as "black quarry rock," presumably named for the black, volcanic rock of Jalisco, Mexico. The Cantera Negra Extra Anejo ("extra aged") tequila is aged for at least 3 years prior to bottling... a long time for any tequila and longer than the minimum 2 years required for extra anejo designations.

They regard it as their highest quality tequila. The brand takes special pride in carefully selecting the agave plants and aging a portion of their tequila in their own oak barrels (the rest aged in the more common method of ex-bourbon barrels).
 

Cantera Negra tequila is a brand founded by Don Alberto Becherano and imported into the United States by Two Sons Imprts. The distiller is Cavas de Don Max, who lay claim to the ability to call their tequila "elixir de agave."

100% Blue Agave. Among the first tequilas to be classified as ""Extra Añejo."" Marries tequila with an average age of four years with reserves aged up to 15 years. Complex flavors of oak, maple, almonds and cloves with a long warm cinnamon hinted finish.

bottle: Gran Reserva De Don Alberto Extra Anejo
description: Mexico- Rested for 2 years in French Oak barrels and then 1 additional year in medium charred white oak, this is a whiskey-lovers tequila. It's warm brown spices marry with notes of dried fruit and butterscotch where the oak is evident from the nose through the finish.

Mexico- Aged a minimum of three and a half years. Aromas of dried fruit, caramel, dark chocolate, smoky flavors, hazelnut and nutmeg. Full bodied entry leads to perfect balance between wood and sweet notes of caramel and dark chocolate. Long, elegant finish.

bottle: El Mayor Rum Cask Finish Extra Anejo Tequila
description: An exquisite Extra Añejo tequila, aged for over three and a half years, distilled from blue weber agave and finished in rum casks. With hints of caramel on the nose, and smooth, sweet, lingering finish. El Mayor® Rum Cask Finish brings depth and richness to be savored slowly.

Made from 100% Agave this tequila reserva presents vanilla, nut and cognac-like flavors which can be sipped in a brandy snifter. Since 1795 the Cuervo family has been sharing their finest reservas during special family and friend gathers and now you can share the experience.

bottle: Lobos Extra Anejo PX Sherry Finish
description:
Lobos 1707 Tequila, Extra Añejo is the alpha Tequila. With over 400 years of refinement that harkens back to 1707, it's backed by the ultimate alpha: basketball legend Lebron James.

Born of 100% pure Blue Weber agave Tequila, it is aged to perfection for three years in American white oak barrels and finished in the brand’s historic Pedro Ximénez (PX) wine barrels using the solera method. This permits the Tequila time to evolve, resulting in a lasting, flavorful experience. Superbly unorthodox in flavor. Unapologetically smooth.

Aged for 3.5 years in a retired & charred white oak American bourbon barrel to allow every essence from the barrel to come forth. A work of art emerges delivering an amazing Tequila. This 11 year process simply delivers a superior & world class drink.

Felipe started distilling small batches of tequila for family and friends in 1994 at his uncle’s ranch in Jalisco, Mexico but his family tradition of making tequila dates back to the 1920's when his grandfather, Roberto Mares Sr., and his family arrived from Mexico. 

Darren, a serial entrepreneur with a love for car racing, teamed up with Felipe in 2017 and have broadened their circle of loyal Amigos who enjoy The Bad Stuff, in addition to paving the way for new products including a Reposado, Blanco, and even a 12 year tequila!

Felipe and Darren not only share The Bad Stuff with Amigos in numerous states, but also enjoy sharing The Bad Stuff lifestyle through photos and events involving racing, surfing, sailing, and adventure.

A meticulously crafted, award-winning, premium Extra Añejo. Flavors of nutmeg, allspice, caramelized roasted agave & vanilla.

Like Sloe gin, our Damson is hand made in the traditional way; in small batches, using hand-picked British damsons and a moderate amount of sugar.

We slowly mature an abundance of damsons in our London Dry. The fruits combine with the smoothness of the gin to give an intense fruity dryness.
Vapor distilled local Washington grown lavender, creates a great nose that comes through with just the right amount of flavor on the palate. Smooth, crisp and fresh tasting. Subtle, yet distinctive!
The mighty duo of mint and chocolate are perfectly combined and blended with the smooth, 100% clear corn whiskey for a taste that starts with a hint of mint and then adds a bit of chocolate.

Mark Rogers’ American Peach moonshine tastes like wild, sweet nectar from sun ripened peaches with the mighty bite and balance, You remember that country road side stand like the back of your hand holding that soft, velvet fruit picked in the dead of a summer afternoon.

Tennessee- Hazelnut Rum meets the nose with sweet aromas of toasted hazelnut and brown sugar. It is a smooth, full-bodied spirit that blends the tastes of vanilla, cinnamon, and honey. At 80 proof, this brown spirit finishes with a sweet, oaky kick sure to satisfy the rum-lover in you!

Pineapple is the literal translation for the Spanish pina. Amongst the jimadors and tequileras, pina also refers to the heart of the agave plant. For Agave Head Spirits, pina represents even more; it is the pineapple, the heart of the agave and the heart of our vision.

Hints of cinnamon and spice mingle with bananas and vanilla in a way that is reminiscent of a Bananas Foster. The finish is sweet, smooth and absolutely delightful. Enjoy in your favorite tropical cocktail.
Absolut Apeach has a smooth and mellow taste with a sophisticated and fruity character of peach. As with all members of the Absolut vodka family, Absolut Apeach is made from all-natural ingredients.

The Absolut Craft range was launched for bartenders in 2012, after the Swedish vodka company hired Nick Strangeway, mixology extraordinaire, to create three fantastic expressions. This is the Herbaceous Lemon flavoured vodka, made with infusions of lemon myrtle, lemon thyme and lemongrass.

The Absolut Craft range was introduced in 2012, comprising of three flavoured vodkas created for the renowned Swedish vodka brand by Nick Strangeway, mixology extraordinaire. These were originally released exclusively for bartenders to use in experimental (and delicious) cocktails. This is the Smokey Tea flavoured vodka, infused with lapsang souchong tea, ginger, clove and bitter orange - a mysterious, fragrant and fairly intense expression.

Made with Absolut vodka, fruit juice, and natural flavors. Smooth with a well-balanced sweetness followed by soft floral notes and vanilla. Less than 99 calories per serving and no artificial flavors.

bottle: Limited Editoin Boston (Black Tea and Elderflower)
description:
Absolut Boston is the third in the company’s ‘Cities’ range, following Absolut New Orleans and Absolut Brooklyn.

A special limited-edition litre bottle of Absolut Boston, which has been flavoured with an intriguing combination of black tea and elderflower.

ABSOLUT VANILIA is made exclusively from natural ingredients, and unlike most other flavored vodkas, it doesnt contain any added sugar. ABSOLUT VANILIA is rich, robust and complex. It has a distinct character of vanilla, notes of butterscotch and hints of dark chocolate.
A mouthwatering Polish rye vodka infused with natural cocoa to make this superb choccy vodka. Alchemia continue to impress.

Ginger infused Vodka Alchemia is Polish for alchemy. Flavoured vodkas merely add engineered ingredients during the distillation process while Alchemia a triple distilled Polish rye grain vodka is macerated with natural ingredients lending to a authentic rich colour and flavour. On the nose and palette is of a genuine ginger feel with a touch of heat great for spicy cocktail experimentations.

Like America itself, American Harvest was built on a promise. From field to bottle, a promise to create the finest quality products, without compromise to the environment or our nations national resources. American Harvest is proudly handcrafted in small batches from organic American wheat, certified organic ingredients and water from deep beneath the snake River plain, yielding a distinctly smooth and silky spirit with a crisp, clean taste.

Our Spirits start as organic estate-grown grain that has been milled, mashed, fermented and expertly distilled in our Bainbridge Island stillhouse by our owner and Master Distiller Keith Barnes and his talented team of distillers.

California- We start with the same base as our Vodka and use a combination of Maceration and Vapor distillation of Valencia oranges grown right here locally in Orange County at the Heritage Museum of Orange County.

Made with real cranberries, grown by family-owned farms in New England, our Original Vodka and lightly sweetened with real cane sugar. Deep Eddy Cranberry is refreshing and cosmopolitan, perfect for pairing with good times on any occasion.

Made with real lemon juice and our silky smooth Deep Eddy Original Vodka and lightly sweetened with real cane sugar, Deep Eddy Lemon is like a ray of Texas Sunshine, bringing people together for good times. Very sweet.
Deep Eddy Peach Vodka is handcrafted in our Texas distillery from real peaches and our award winning Original Vodka. Capturing the true essence of ripe peaches; very very sweet.

Deep Eddy Ruby Red Vodka starts with our award-winning Original Vodka and is infused with real Ruby Red Grapefruit juice and lightly sweetened with real cane sugar for a deliciously tart, refreshing taste, perfect for day-drinking with family and friends.

Deep Eddy Sweet Tea begins with our 10x-distilled Original Vodka, to which we add real, whole-leaf Indonesian Black Tea and sweeten with a hint of organic honey from a local Texas Hill Country apiary. Deep Eddy Sweet Tea Vodka was

The only sugar free, gluten free, low calorie, protein infused vodka. Devotion Vodka uses protein as a smoothing agent in a four-column distilled premium vodka. The floral aroma and taste of Blood Orange will rile up your taste buds.

Texas- Rested in new French oak wine barrels. This vodka is the kind you would like to sip straight or on the rocks. It has a slight vanilla flavor with a kiss of oak. It makes a smooth and interesting vodka martini or can be mixed in a cocktail like a Cosmopolitan.

Based upon our Ultra Premium Enchanted Rock Texas Vodka®, this spirit is infused with natural peach flavor that will remind you of the harvest time peaches you can sometimes get by the roadside. Enchanted Rock Peach Vodka® has an aroma reminiscent of dried apricots and peaches with a background of light sweetness. This medium high bodied spirit's flavor begins with a sweet impression that is pleasing on the palate, a fresh peach middle and finishes with a sweet peach background. A delicious tipple by itself, Enchanted Rock Peach Vodka® is equally at home in mixed drinks.

California- Each spirit from this distillery is made to be something distinct and undeniably delicious. The finest grains are selected then combined with innovative and traditional distilling methods to create an exquisitely balanced spirit that speaks for itself
ade with 100% certified organic American wheat, then infused with hand zested organic California lemons. Flavors are crisp, vivid and true to the tastes of ripe citrus.

L’Orange Flavored Vodka is made from the essence of oranges harvested year round. As with the superior bread making wheat used to make GREY GOOSE Vodka, Cellar Master François Thibault insists on only the finest oranges to produce the best possible orange vodka. Essential oils from the fresh fruit are mixed with the wheat spirit and distilled to achieve the signature vibrant citrus character of GREY GOOSE L’Orange Flavored Vodka.

There are lots of citrus-flavored vodkas, but most are flavored with highly purified extracts, which means they have only a single note. We make Hangar One with whole fresh fruit, which of course includes seeds, skin, pits, and juice, and all the fresh citrus oils. That?s why Hangar One vodkas have far more complex flavors. They hit the palate in more spots. They just taste richer. When you taste the Buddha?s Hand, it doesn?t have only the focused intensity of, say, a standard lemon. It also has wonderful jasmine overtones, as well as hints of fruitcake spices

Infused with the flavoring of mandarin blossoms picked at the height of bloom allow distillers to capture complex and floral citrus characteristics without having to depend on unstable acids from the fruit’s juice. Just like peeling a tangerine.
Made with real chili peppers. Discontinued.

A whiskey-brown spirit with numerous apple slices floating at the top of the bottle. The nose is pure apple, with touches of cinnamon, just like grandma used to bake. Smooth as silk on the body - the vodka is really only evident on the finish, as the sweet, dessert-like character of the product takes center stage... a fun change of pace to be sure.

This gold-medal winning infusion is something to be marveled. The twists and turns of the thinly cut peel make for a perfect artistic visual in this  craft vodka, as well speaks to the brand's natural-infusion ethos. 

Infuse's Lemon vodka has a pale yellow hue and bright candied-lemon peel scent. The spirit feels silky and viscous on the tongue and evokes waxy lemon peel flavors. Well-chilled, this is a bracing martini option.

It has a robust orange-gold color, and an aroma of fresh mangos, subtle peppers and spiced hazelnut, similar to a mango paleta. On the mouth, it's hot and sweet, with a medium body, and has an exciting hint of papaya and mango, along with various pepper-jelly notes. Mango Habanero is truly one of a kind. Perfectly paired with a Bloody Mary, Mango Habanero has a serious spiciness and flavor that is unmistakably different from other pepper or chipotle vodkas.

A limited seasonal release, this corn-based vodka is made with ribbons of Navel orange peel and clove, yielding a golden glow and bright cinnamon aroma. The palate is relatively light and doesn't show much citrus, though it has a lingering thread of cinnamon and clove heat that accelerates into the drying finish

No fake peach flavoring here: you'll see the fruit segments bobbing in the bottle, and detect it in the pleasantly sweet, true-peach scent. Perhaps because the vodka is made from a corn base, the bright tawny liquid is reminiscent of peach-flavored Bourbon; it has a boozy presence, and a long finish that hints at vanilla and bruised peaches.
A limited seasonal release, this corn-based vodka is made with juniper berries and dried pears; flavors of elderflower and a long, mildly medicinal finish.

There's no substitute for natural flavor, that's why when we make Ketel One Citroen, we start by sourcing the world's finest fresh lemons and limes. Then, with the greatest care, extract the crisp, tangy flavor and infuse it into our vodka to deliver surprising notes of sweet lemon zest on the nose and subtle hints of freshly-cut lime on the tongue. It's a unique combination truly worthy of the Nolet family name. Our 80 proof vodka is meticulously crafted using exclusively 100% non-GMO grain for smoothness and is distilled in copper pot stills for a unique and refreshing tasting finish. This vodka is perfect for sipping on its own or added with your favorite cocktail. Simply mix with lime juice, pineapple juice and triple sec, then garnish with berries and a bay leaf for a dazzling Mesha cocktail. Includes one 80 proof 1 L bottle of Ketel One Citroen Flavored Vodka. Please drink responsibly.

On the nose, Oranje produces pleasant citrus and wildflower notes, along with a slight undercurrent of essential oil. The palate is a pleasantly refreshing orange, bright and fruity with the right balance of sweetness and no bitter or burnt finish.
Nemiroff Honey Pepper is very nice Vodka from Ukraine with an alcohol content of 40 % Volume 1 Liter

New Amsterdam® Lemon vodka offers a refreshing, crisp profile layered with sweet, bright lemon flavors. The complexity of the natural fruit flavor is perfectly balanced with just enough bite for a clean, smooth finish.

New Amsterdam® Peach tastes like biting into a fresh, Georgia peach. Succulent peach flavor is rounded out with orange blossom and a touch of vanilla to create a complex and pleasant fruit profile. Its soft, refreshing mouthfeel leads to a smooth, clean finish.
Oddka is a 40% ABV vodka from Poland. The vodka is produced by SA and imported by Pernod Ricard USA. The quality is considered to be great.

Garlic is a special ingredient in Ukrainian cuisine, so it is clear why four hundred years ago the Ukrainians decided to infuse Pervak with garlic. Having studied dozens of recipes of such tinctures (“nastoianka”) we have created a homemade Pervak with garlic.

A rather unusual flavoured vodka from Sputnik, triple distilled and infused with handpicked organic Horseradish from a farm with sells to the top Russian restaurants. This also makes a great spicy Bloody Mary - just add tomato juice and season to your taste - and is a perfect match for a steak.

Pinky Vodka first launched globally in 2008, it instantly became famous for its instantly recognisable pink hue! Distilled five times from pure glacial water and slightly sweet winter wheat, Pinky is hand blended with violets, rose petals, and ten other botanicals.

For time savored, not spent, Plume & Petal is a premium, gluten-free vodka infused with delicate, natural fruit, botanical and tea with just a hint of honey.
